question: Who are some of the other companions that narrated similar teachings about changing gray hair?

hadith-eng: That the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Indeed the best of what the gray may be changed with is Henna' and Katam."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih. Abu Al-Aswad Ad-Dili's (a narrator in this chain) name is Zalim bin 'Amr bin Sufyan.
question: What is the significance of using Henna and Katam according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was of average height, neither tall nor very short, he had a good build, brown in complexion, his hair was neither curly nor straight, and when he walked he swayed slightly."He said: There are narration on this topic from 'Aishah, Al-Bara', Abu Hurairah, Ibn 'Abbas, Abu Sa'eed, Jabir, Wa'il bin Hujr, and Umm Hani'.[Abu 'Eisa said:] The Hadith of Anas is a Hasan Sahih Gharib Hadith from this route, as a narration of Humaid.
question: Which companions have narrated similar descriptions of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng:
"I and the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) would perform Ghusl using (water from) the same vessel. He had hair reaching above his shoulders and below his earlobes."This Hadith is Hasan Sahih Gharib.
[Abu 'Eisa said:] It has been reported from other routes that 'Aishah said: "I and the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) would perform Ghusl using (water from) the same vessel." And the following statement is not mentioned in it: "He had hair reaching above his shoulders [and below his earlobes'."It was only mentioned by 'Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Az-Zinad, and he is trustworthy, a Hafiz, and Malik bin Anas stated that he was trustworthy and ordered recording (Ahadith) from him.
question: What can be inferred about the Prophet Muhammad's (ﷺ) physical appearance from this narration?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited combing except every other day.
question: What are some practices that the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) discouraged in daily grooming habits?

hadith-eng: That the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Use Ithmid for Kohl, for it clears the vision and grows the hair (eye-lashes)." And he claimed that the Prophet (ﷺ) had a Kohl holder with which he would apply Kohl every night, three in this (eye) and three in this.Another chain with similar meaning.He said: There are narrations on this topic from Jabir and Ibn 'Umar[Abu 'Eisa said:] The Hadith of Ibn 'Abbas is a Hasan Gharib Hadith, we do not know of it with this wording except from the narration of 'Abbas bin Mansur.
question: What is the significance of applying kohl three times in each eye as mentioned in the narration?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited two types of dress: As-Sama', and that a man sits with his legs drawn up in a garment, while there is nothing covering his private area.[Abu 'Eisa said:] There are narrations on this topic from 'Ali, Ibn 'Umar, 'Aishah, Abu Sa'eed, Jabir, and Abu Umamah. The Hadith if Abu Hurairah is a Hasan Sahih Gharib Hadith from this route.This has been reported through other routes from Abu Hurairah from the Prophet (ﷺ).
question: What are the implications of sitting with legs drawn up in a garment without covering the private area in Islamic jurisprudence?

hadith-eng: That the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Allah has cursed the woman who artificially lengthens and the woman who seeks to have her hair artificially lengthened, and the woman who tattoos and the woman who seeks tattooed." Nafi' (one of the narrators) said: "Tattooing was on the gums."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.He said: There are narrations on this topic from Ibn Mas'ud, 'Aishah, Asma' bint Abi Bakr, Ma'qil bin Yasar, Ibn 'Abbas, and Mu'awiyah.
question: What are the implications of receiving a curse from Allah in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited riding (while sitting on) Miyathir."[Abu 'Eisa said:] There are narrations on this topic from 'Ali and Mu'awiyah. The Hadith if Al-Bara' is Hasan Sahih. Shu'bah reported similarly from Ash'ath bin Abi Ash-Sha'tha' in the lengthy Hadith.
question: How do different narrations contribute to understanding the teachings of the Prophet (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng: "The only bed that the Messenger of Allah had which he slept was [made of a tanned skin] stuffed with palm-fibres."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.He Said: There are narrations on thus topic from Hafsah and Jabir.
question: What can be learned from the Prophet's choice of a bed made from tanned skin and palm-fibres?

hadith-eng: "The most loved garment to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was the Qamis (long shirt)."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Gharib. We only know of it as a narration of 'Abdul-Mu'min bin Khalid (a narrator in the chain of this Hadith) who was alone in narrating it, and he is from Al-Marwaz. Some of them report this Hadith from Abu Tumailah, from 'Abdul-Mu'min bin Khalid, from 'Abdullah bin Buraidah, from his mother, from Umm Salamah. He said: I heard Muhammad bin Ism'ail saying: "The narration of Ibn Buraidah from his mother, from Umm Salamah is more correct, Abu Tumailah mentioned 'his mother' in it."
question: What is the significance of the Qamis in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: "The most loved garment to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was the Qamis (long shirt)."
question: How does the preference of the Prophet (ﷺ) for certain garments influence Islamic dress code?

hadith-eng: "The most loved garment to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was the Qamis (long shirt)."
question: How does the preference of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) for certain garments influence Islamic dress code?

hadith-eng: "The sleeves of (the shirt) of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) were to the wrist."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Gharib.
question: What significance does the length of the sleeves have in understanding the Prophet's attire?

hadith-eng: "When the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) put on a Qamis he began with the right side.[Abu 'Eisa said:] Others have reported this Hadith from Shu'bah with this chain, but they dod narrate it in Marfu' form, only 'Abdus-Samad narrated it Marfu'.
question: What does the term 'Marfu'' mean in the context of hadith narration?

hadith-eng: "When the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), would wear a new garment he would mention what it was, whether an 'Imamah, a Qamis, or a Rida', then he would say: Allahumma lakal-hamdu, Anta kasawtanihi, as'aluka khairuhu wa khaira ma suni'a lahu, wa a'udhu bika min sharrihi wa sharri ma suni'a lahu'" ('O Allah! For You is the praise, You have clothed me, I ask You for its good and the god for which it was made, and I seek refuge in You from its evil and the evil for which it was made.)[Abu 'Eisa said:] There are narrations on this topic from 'Umar, and Ibn 'Umar.
question: What does the supplication made by the Prophet (ﷺ) when wearing new clothes teach about the relationship between humans and their possessions?

hadith-eng: From his father: "The Prophet (ﷺ) wore a Roman Jubbah with tight sleeves."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.
question: What significance does the mention of a Roman Jubbah have in understanding the Prophet's (ﷺ) lifestyle?

hadith-eng: From Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah: "Dihyah Al-Kalbi gave a pair of Khuff to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), so he wore them."[Abu 'Eisa said:] Isra'il said: "From Jabir, from 'Amir: 'And a Jubbah, so he wore them until they tore. And the Prophet (ﷺ) did not know whether they were from a slaughtered animal or not.'"This Hadith is Hasan Gharib. Abu Ishaq, the one who reported from Ash-Sha'bi, is Abu Ishaq Ash-Shaibani, and his name is Sulaiman. Al-Hasan bin 'Ayyash is the brother of Abu Bakr bin 'Ayyash.
question: What is the role of companions like Dihyah Al-Kalbi in the life of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng: "My nose was severed on the Day of Al-Kulab during Jahiliyyah. So I got a nose of silver which caused an infection for me, so the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) ordered me to get a node made of gold."
question: What does this incident reveal about the Prophet's (ﷺ) approach to practical solutions for health issues?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet (ﷺ) prohibited predator skins." And this chain is more correct.
question: How does the prohibition of predator skins reflect Islamic principles on animal treatment?

hadith-eng: "I asked Anas bin Malik: 'How were the sandals of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) ? He said: 'They had two straps.'"
question: What details are provided about the Prophet's sandals in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: From Anas: "The sandals of the Prophet (ﷺ) had two straps."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.He said: There are narrations on this topic from Ibn 'Abbas, and Abu Hurairah.
question: What can be learned from the descriptions of the Prophet's (ﷺ) attire and accessories?

hadith-eng: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Do not walk in one sandal, either wear both sandals, or go barefoot."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.He said: There is something on this topic from Jabir.
question: How does this teaching reflect on the importance of balance and completeness in daily practices?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited that a man should put on sandals while he is standing."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Gharib. 'Ubaidullah bin 'Amr Ar-Raqqi reported this Hadith from Ma'mar, from Qatadah, from Anas. Both of the Ahadith are not correct according to the people of Hadith. Al-Harith bin Nabhan is not a Hafiz according to them, and we do not know any basis for the narration of Qatadah from Anas.
question: What are the implications of a hadith being classified as Hasan Gharib?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited that a man should put on sandals while he is standing."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Gharib. Muhammad bin Isma'il said: "This Hadith is not correct, not the Hadith of Ma'mar from 'Ammar bin Abi 'Ammar, from Abu Hurairah (no.1775)."
question: What are the implications of a hadith being classified as 'Gharib'?

hadith-eng: "Sometimes the Prophet (ﷺ) would walk in one sandal."
question: What lessons can be learned about contentment and resourcefulness from the Prophet's (ﷺ) actions?

hadith-eng: From his father, about 'Aishah that: "She would walk in one sandal."This is more correct. [Abu 'Eisa said:] This is how it was reported by Sufyan Ath-Thawri and others, from 'Abdur-Rahman bin Al-Qasim, in Mawquf form, and this is more correct.
question: What is the significance of the Mawquf form in hadith classification?

hadith-eng: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "When one of you dons sandals, then let him begin with the right. And when he removes them then let him begin with left, so that the right will be the first to put on and the last of them removed."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.
question: How does the practice of putting on and removing sandals reflect broader principles in Islamic etiquette?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said to me: 'If you want to stick with me, then suffice yourself in the world with the provisions of the rider. And beware of gatherings of the rich, and do not consider a garment to be worn out until it has been patched.'"[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Gharib, we do not know of it except as a narration of Salih bin Hassan. He said: I heard Muhammad bin Isma'il saying: "Salih bin Hassan is Munkar is Hadith." And Salih bin Hassan - the one who Ibn Abi Dhi'b reports from - is trustworthy.[Abu 'Eisa said:] The meaning of this saying: "And beware of gathering of the rich" is similar to what was related from Abu Hurairah from the Prophet (ﷺ), that he said: "Whoever sees one that has been more favored than him in appearance and provision, then let him look at the one who is less than him, rather than one who is favored more than him. For indeed it is more appropriate so that he not scorn Allah's favors [upon him]."And it has been related from 'Awn bin 'Abdullah who said: "I accompanied the rich, and did not see anyone with more troubles than me. I saw a beast that was better than my beast, and a garment that was better than my garment. And I accompanied the poor, and felt at ease."
question: How can one maintain gratitude for Allah's favors when comparing themselves to others?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) arrived in Makkah, and he had four braids."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Gharib. Muhammad said: "I do not know of Mujahid (a narrator) hearing from Umm Hani."
question: What are the challenges faced by scholars in verifying the chain of narrators in hadith transmission?

hadith-eng: "I heard Abu Kabshah Al-Anmari saying: 'The Kimam (caps) of the Companions of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) were Buthan (stretched over the head).'"[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Munkar,  'Abdullah bin Busr is from Al-Basrah, and he is weak according to the people of Hadith. Yahya bin Sa'eed and others graded him weak. Buthun means expansive.
question: What does the term 'Buthan' refer to in the context of the Companions' attire?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) took hold of the calf of my shin - or his shin - and he said: "This is the place of the Izar, if you must lower it, then the Izar has no right to be on the ankles."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih. Ath-Thawri and Shu'bah reported it from Abu Ishaq.
question: How does the hadith emphasize the proper way of wearing the Izar?

hadith-eng: From his father that Rukanah wrestled the Prophet (ﷺ) and the Prophet (ﷺ) won the match. Rukanah said: "I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying: 'Indeed what distinguishes between us and between the idolater is the turban over the cap.'"[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Gharib. Its chain is not established, and we do not know of Abu Al-Hasan Al-'Asqalani, nor Ibn Rukanah.
question: What can be inferred about the authenticity of hadiths with chains that are not well-established?

hadith-eng: From his father who said: "A man wearing an iron ring came to the Prophet (ﷺ). So he said to him: 'What is this I see on you, jewelry of the people of the Fire ?' Then he came wearing a ring of brass. So he said: 'What is this smell of idols I sense on you ?' Then he came wearing a ring of gold. So he said to him: 'What is this jewelry of the people of Paradise I see on you ?' So he said: 'What should I use then ?' He said: 'From silver, but not its entire weight."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Gharib and there are narrations on this topic from 'Abdullah bin 'Amr, and 'Abdullah bin Muslim's Kunyah is Abu Taibah, and he is from Al-Marwaz.
question: What guidance does Islam provide regarding the use of gold for men?

hadith-eng: "I heard 'Ali saying: 'The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited Al-Qassi, the red Mitharah, and wearing rings on this and this.' And he pointed to the index and middle fingers."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih. Ibn Abi Musa is Abu Burdah bin Abi Musa and his name is 'Amir bin 'Abdullah bin Qais.
question: Who narrated the hadith about the prohibition of certain items and practices?

hadith-eng: "The garment the Messenger (ﷺ) like most to wear was the Hibrah."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih Gharib.
question: How does the preference of the Prophet (ﷺ) for certain garments influence Islamic dress code?

hadith-eng: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Wearing silk and gold has made unlawful for the males of my Ummah and lawful for its females.[Abu 'Eisa said:] There are narrations on this topic from 'Umar, 'Ali, 'Uqbah bin 'Amir, Anas, Umm Hani, Hudhaifah, 'Abdullah bin 'Amr, 'Imran bin Husain, 'Abdullah bin Az-Zubair, Jabir, Abu Raihanah, Ibn 'Umar, Al-Bara', and Wathilah bin Al-Asqa', and this Hadith is Hasan Sahih.
question: How does the prohibition of certain materials for males reflect Islamic principles of modesty and humility?

hadith-eng: That 'Umar gave a Khutbah at Al-Jabiyah and he said: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited silk except for two finger's worth of space, or three, or four."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.
question: Why is the hadith about the prohibition of silk considered Hasan Sahih?

hadith-eng: That 'Abdur Rahman bin 'Awf and Az-Zubair bin Al-'Awwam complained of lice to the Prophet (ﷺ) during a battle that they participated in. So he permitted them to wear silk shirts. He  (Anas) said: "I saw them wearing them."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih
question: How does Islamic law accommodate the well-being of individuals in challenging circumstances?

hadith-eng: "Anas bin Malik arrived. So I went to him and he said: 'Who are you ?' I said: 'I am Waqid bin 'Amr [bin Sa'd bin Ma'adh].'" He said: "So he began to cry and he said: 'You resemble Sa'd. Sa'd was one of the greatest people, and of the tallest. The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was sent a cloak of Dibaj with gold woven into it. The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) wore it and ascended the Minbar. Then he stood, or sat, and the people began touching it, and they said: 'We never saw a garment like this before today.' So he said: 'Are you amazed at this ? The handkerchiefs of Sa'd in Paradise are better than what you see.'"He said: There is something on this topic from Asma' bint Abu Bakr. This Hadith is Sahih.
question: What can be inferred about the Prophet's teachings on material wealth and its comparison to the hereafter?

hadith-eng: "I have not seen anyone with hair past his shoulders in a red Hullah more handsome than the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ). He had hair that would flow on his shoulders, (and he had) broad shoulders (and he was) not too short and not too long."[Abu 'Eisa said:] There are narrations on this topic from Jabir bin Samurah, Abu Rimthah, and Abu Juhaifah. This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.
question: How do different narrators contribute to the understanding of the Prophet's physical appearance?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited wearing Al-Qassi and what was dyed with 'Usfur."[Abu 'Eisa said:] There are narrations on this topic from Anas and 'Abdullah bin 'Amr.
question: What are the implications of wearing Al-Qassi in the context of Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was asked about fat, cheese, and furs, so he said: 'The lawful is what Allah made lawful in His Book, the unlawful is what Allah made unlawful in his Book, and what He was silent about; then it is among that for which He has pardoned.'"[Abu 'Eisa said:] There is something on this topic from Al-Mughirah, and this Hadith is Gharib, we do not know of it being Marfu' except from this route. Sufyan and others reported it from Sulaiman At-Taimi, from Abu 'Uthman, from Salman as his own saying. It is as if the Mawquf narration is more correct. I asked Al-Bukhari about this Hadith and he said: 'I do not think it is preserved. Sufyan reported it from Sulaiman At-Taimi from Abu 'Uthman, from Salman in Mawquf form.' Al-Bukhari said: "Saif bin Harun is Muqarib (Average) in Hadith, and as for Saif bin Muhammad from 'Asim, his narrations are left."
question: How do scholars verify the authenticity of hadiths and their narrations?

hadith-eng: "A sheep died so the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said to its owners: 'Why dont you remove its skin, then tan it so you can have something useful from it."[Abu 'Eisa said:] There are narrations on this topic from Salamah bin Al-Muhabbaq, Maimunah, and 'Aishah. The Hadith of Ibn 'Abbas is Hasan Sahih. Similar to this has been reported through other routes from Ibn 'Abbas from the Prophet (ﷺ). And it has been related from Ibn 'Abbas from Maimunah, from the Prophet (ﷺ), and, it has been related from him from Sawdah. I heard Muhammad saying the Hadith of Ibn 'Abbas from Maimunah from the Prophet (ﷺ) were correct. And he said: "It implies that it was reported from Ibn 'Abbas from Maimunah from the Prophet (ﷺ), and that Ibn 'Abbas reported it from the Prophet (ﷺ), and he did not mention Maimunah in it."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This is acted upon according to most of the people of knowledge, and it is the view of Sufyan At-Thawri, Ibn Al-Mubarak, Ash-Shafi'i, Ahmad, and Ishaq.
question: How does the hadith reflect the Prophet Muhammad's (ﷺ) guidance on resourcefulness and sustainability?

hadith-eng: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Any skin tanned, then it has been made pure."This Hadith is Hasan Sahih. This is acted upon according to most of the people of knowledge, they say that when the skin of a dead animal has been tanned then it has been made pure.[Abu 'Eisa said:] Ash-Shafi'i said: "Any dead animals skin that is tanned, then it has been made pure, except for the dog and the pig." Some of the people of knowledge among the Companions of the Prophet (ﷺ) disliked skins of predators even when tanned, and this is the view of 'Abdullah bin Al-Mubarak, Ahmad and Ishaq, and they were firm about not wearing them and performing Salat in them. Ishaq bin Ibrahim said: "The saying of the Prophet (ﷺ):'Any skin that is tanned, then it has been made pure' only refers to the skins of animals whose meat is eaten." This is how it was explained by An-Nasr bin Shumail.
question: What is the stance of some Companions of the Prophet on using tanned skins of predators?

hadith-eng: "A letter came from the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying: 'Do not use the skins of dead animals, nor tendons.'"[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan. This Hadith has been related to 'Abdullah bin 'Ukaim from some Shuyukh of his, and this is not acted upon according to most of the people of knowledge. And this Hadith has been related from 'Abdullah bin 'Ukaim, that he said: "A letter came to us from the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) two months before he died."He said: I heart Ahmad bin Al-Hasan saying: "Ahmad bin Hanbal followed this Hadith due to it mentioning that it was two months before he (ﷺ) died. Then Ahmad left this Hadith because of their Idtirab in its chain, since some of them reported it, saying: 'From 'Abdullah bin 'Ukaim from some Shuyukh of his from Juhainah.'"
question: How does the concept of Idtirab affect the acceptance of a hadith in Islamic jurisprudence?

hadith-eng: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "On the day of judgement, Allah will not look at one who arrogantly drags his garment.[Abu 'Eisa said:] There are narrations on this topic from Hudhaifah, Abu Sa'eed, Abu Hurairah, Samurah, Abu Dharr, 'Aishah and Hubaib bin Mughfil. The Hadith of Ibn 'Umar is Hasan Sahih.
question: What lessons can be learned from the hadith regarding the behavior and attitude of a believer?

hadith-eng: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Whoever arrogantly drags his garment, Allah will not look at him on the Day of Judgement." So Umm Salamah said: "What should the women do with their hems?" He said: "Slacken them a handspan." So she said: "Then their feet will be uncovered." He said: "Then slacken them a forearm's length and do not add to that."He said: This Hadith is Hasan Sahih. In the Hadith there is a concession for women to drag their Izar because it covers them better.
question: Why is it important to avoid arrogance in one's attire in Islam?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet (ﷺ) slackened Fatimah's garment a hand-span."[Abu 'Eisa said:] Some of them reported it from Hammad bin Salamah, from 'Ali bin Zaid, from Al-Hasan, from his father, from Umm Salamah.
question: How are family interactions guided by Islamic principles of modesty and respect?

hadith-eng: "'Aishah brought a patched woolen Kisa' (cloak), and a thick Izar, She said: 'The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) died in these.'"[Abu 'Eisa said:] There are narrations on this topic from 'Ali and Ibn Mas'ud. The Hadith if 'Aishah is Hasan Sahih Hadith.
question: How do the narrations from 'Ali and Ibn Mas'ud contribute to the understanding of the Prophet's lifestyle?

hadith-eng: That the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "On the day of His Lord spoke to him, Musa was wearing a wool Kisa', a wool Jubbah, a wool Kummah, wool pants, and his sandals were made of the skin of a dead donkey."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Gharib, we do not know of it except from the the narration of Humaid Al-A'raj. And Humaid - Ibn 'Ali Al-A'raj - I Heard Muhammad saying: "Humaid bin 'Ali Al-A'raj is Munkar in Hadith." While Humaid ibn Qais Al-A'raj Al-Makki, the companion of Mujahid is trustworthy. The Kummah is a small cap.
question: How is the reliability of narrators assessed in the context of hadith transmission?

hadith-eng: "On the day of the Conquest, the Prophet (ﷺ) entered Makkah, and he was wearing a black 'Imamah."[He said:] THere are narrations on this topic from 'Ali, 'Amr bin Huraith, Ibn 'Abbas, Rukanah.[Abu 'Eisa said:] The Hadith is Jabir is Hasan Sahih Hadith.
question: What is the significance of wearing an 'Imamah in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: That Ibn 'Umar said: "When the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) would wear an 'Imamah would hang between his shoulders."Nafi' said: "Ibn 'Umar would hang his 'Imamah between his shoulders." 'Ubaidullah said: "And I saw Al-Qasim and Salim doing that."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Gharib. And there is something on this topic from 'Ali. And this Hadith of 'Ali about this is not correct due to its chain.
question: Why is the authenticity of a hadith chain important in Islamic scholarship?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited me from rings of gold, and from wearing Al-Qassi, and from reciting in the bowing and prostration positions, and from wearing what was dyed with 'Usfur."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.
question: What is the ruling on wearing garments dyed with 'Usfur in Islam?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited us from (wearing) rings of gold."[He said:] THere are narrations on this topic from 'Ali, Ibn 'Umar, Abu Hurairah, and Mu'awiyah.[Abu 'Eisa said:] The Hadith of 'Imran is a Hasan Hadith. Abu At-Tayyah's (a narrator) name is Yazid bin Humaid.
question: What is the significance of the term 'Hasan Hadith' in Islamic scholarship?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet (ﷺ) had ring made of silver and its stone (Fass) was Ethiopian."He said: There are narrations on this topic from Ibn 'Umar and Buraidah.[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih Gharib from this route.
question: How is the authenticity of this narration classified in Islamic scholarship?

hadith-eng: "The ring of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was made of silver, its Fass was from it."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih Gharib from this route.
question: What does the term 'Hasan Sahih Gharib' indicate about a hadith?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet (ﷺ) had a ring of gold made for him which he wore on his right (hand). Then he sat on the Minbar and said: 'I did indeed have this ring on my right hand' then he discarded it and the people discarded their rings."He said: There are narrations on this topic from 'Ali, Jabir, 'Abdullah bin Ja'far, Ibn 'Abbas, 'Aishah, and Anas.[Abu 'Eisa said:] The Hadith of Ibn 'Umar is Hasan Sahih Hadith. This Hadith has been reported similarly from 'Nafi, from Ibn 'Umar, through routes other than this, and it was not mentioned in it that the ring was on his right hand.
question: What does this narration suggest about the influence of the Prophet's (ﷺ) personal practices on his followers?

hadith-eng: "Ibn Abbas wore a ring on his right hand. And I do not doubt he said: 'I saw the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) wearing a ring on his right hand.'"[Abu 'Eisa said:] Muhammad bin Isma'il said: "The Hadith is Muhammad bin Ishaq from As-Salt bin 'Abdullah bin Nawfal is a Hasan Sahih Hadith."
question: How does the classification of a hadith as Hasan Sahih affect its acceptance and practice in Islam?

hadith-eng: Narrated from his father who said: "Al-Hasan and Al-Husain wore their ring on their left hand."This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.
question: What can be inferred about the cultural practices of Al-Hasan and Al-Husain from their choice of hand for wearing rings?

hadith-eng: "I saw Ibn Rafi' [and he is 'Ubaidullah bin Abi Rafi', the freed slave of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) - and Aslam was the name of Ibn Abi Rafi] wearing a ring on his right, so I asked him about that. He said, 'I saw 'Abdullah bin Ja'far wearing a ring on his right hand, and he ['Abdullah bin Ja'far] said: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) wore a ring on his right hand."He said: Muhammad [bin Isma'il] said: "This is the most correct thing related from the Prophet (ﷺ) on this topic."
question: What is the role of eyewitness testimony in the transmission of hadiths?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) had a ring made from silver, so he had 'Muhammad, the Messenger of Allah' engraved on it. Then he said: 'Do not engrave with it.'[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Sahih Hasan. As for the meaning of his saying: "Do not engrave with it" - he was prohibiting that anyone have "Muhammad, Messenger of Allah" engraved on his ring.
question: What materials were used for the Prophet's ring according to Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: "When the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) entered the area in which he would relieve himself, he would remove the ring."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih Gharib Hadith.
question: What can be learned about the Prophet's (ﷺ) habits regarding personal adornments during specific activities?

hadith-eng: "The inscription on the ring of the Prophet (ﷺ) was in three lines: 'Muhammad' on a line, 'Messenger' on a line, and 'Allah' on a line."
question: What can be learned about the Prophet's ring from the hadith narrated by Anas bin Malik?

hadith-eng: "The inscription on the ring of the Prophet (ﷺ) was in three line: 'Muhammad' on a line, 'Messenger' on a line, 'Allah' on a line." And Muhammad bin Yahya (one of the two who narrated to him) did not say: "Three lines" in his narration.There are narrations on this topic from Ibn 'Umar.[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith of Anas is a Hasan  Sahih Gharib.
question: Who narrated the hadith about the inscription on the Prophet's ring?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited having images in the house, and he prohibited making them."He said: There are narrations on this topic from 'Ali, Abu Talhah, 'Aishah, Abu Hurairah, and Abu Ayyub.[Abu 'Eisa said:] The Hadith of Jabir is a Hasan Sahih Hadith.
question: What is the significance of a hadith being classified as Hasan Sahih?

hadith-eng: From 'Ubaidullah bin 'Abdullah bin 'Utbah, that he entered upon Abu Talhah Al-Ansari to pay him a visit (while he was ill), and he found Sahl bin Hunaif with him. He said: "Abu Talhah called for someone to remove a sheet that was under him. Sahl said to him: 'Why did you remove it?' He replied: 'Because it contains images on it, and the Prophet (ﷺ) said about them what you know.' Sahl said: 'Do he not say: Except for markings on a garment?' He said: 'Yes, but this is better to me.'"[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.
question: What does this narration suggest about the personal preferences of the companions in following the Prophet's (ﷺ) guidance?

hadith-eng: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Whoever fashions an image, he will be punished by Allah until he breathes into it - meaning the soul - and he cannot breath (a soul) into it. And whoever listens to a people's conversation, while they have gone away from him for it, then He will have lead poured into his ears on the Day of Judgement."He said: There are narrations on this topic from 'Abdullah bin Mas'ud, Abu Hurairah, Abu Juhaifah, 'Aishah, and Ibn 'Umar.[Abu 'Eisa said:] The Hadith of Ibn 'Abbas is a Hasan Sahih Hadith.
question: What are the implications of attempting to create life in Islamic belief?

hadith-eng: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Change the gray, and do not resemble the Jews."He said: There are narration on this topic from Az-Zubair, Ibn 'Abbas, Jabir, Abu Dharr, Anas, Abu Rimthah, Al-Jahdamah, Abu At-Tufail, Jabir bin Samurah, Abu Juhaifah, and Ibn 'Umar.[Abu 'Eisa said:] The Hadith of Abu Hurairah is a Hasan Sahih Hadith, and it has been reported through other routes from Abu Hurairah from the Prophet (ﷺ).
question: What does the term 'Hasan Sahih' indicate about the authenticity of a hadith?

hadith-eng: That the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Indeed the best of what the gray may be changed with is Henna' and Katam."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih. Abu Al-Aswad Ad-Dili's (a narrator in this chain) name is Zalim bin 'Amr bin Sufyan.
question: How is the authenticity of a hadith determined in Islamic scholarship?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was of average height, neither tall nor very short, he had a good build, brown in complexion, his hair was neither curly nor straight, and when he walked he swayed slightly."He said: There are narration on this topic from 'Aishah, Al-Bara', Abu Hurairah, Ibn 'Abbas, Abu Sa'eed, Jabir, Wa'il bin Hujr, and Umm Hani'.[Abu 'Eisa said:] The Hadith of Anas is a Hasan Sahih Gharib Hadith from this route, as a narration of Humaid.
question: What is the significance of the Prophet Muhammad's (ﷺ) physical description in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng:
"I and the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) would perform Ghusl using (water from) the same vessel. He had hair reaching above his shoulders and below his earlobes."This Hadith is Hasan Sahih Gharib.
[Abu 'Eisa said:] It has been reported from other routes that 'Aishah said: "I and the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) would perform Ghusl using (water from) the same vessel." And the following statement is not mentioned in it: "He had hair reaching above his shoulders [and below his earlobes'."It was only mentioned by 'Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Az-Zinad, and he is trustworthy, a Hafiz, and Malik bin Anas stated that he was trustworthy and ordered recording (Ahadith) from him.
question: What does this narration suggest about the practice of sharing resources in the household of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited combing except every other day.
question: How does Islamic guidance address the issue of excessive grooming?

hadith-eng: That the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Use Ithmid for Kohl, for it clears the vision and grows the hair (eye-lashes)." And he claimed that the Prophet (ﷺ) had a Kohl holder with which he would apply Kohl every night, three in this (eye) and three in this.Another chain with similar meaning.He said: There are narrations on this topic from Jabir and Ibn 'Umar[Abu 'Eisa said:] The Hadith of Ibn 'Abbas is a Hasan Gharib Hadith, we do not know of it with this wording except from the narration of 'Abbas bin Mansur.
question: What are the sources that mention the use of kohl by the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited two types of dress: As-Sama', and that a man sits with his legs drawn up in a garment, while there is nothing covering his private area.[Abu 'Eisa said:] There are narrations on this topic from 'Ali, Ibn 'Umar, 'Aishah, Abu Sa'eed, Jabir, and Abu Umamah. The Hadith if Abu Hurairah is a Hasan Sahih Gharib Hadith from this route.This has been reported through other routes from Abu Hurairah from the Prophet (ﷺ).
question: How do different companions of the Prophet (ﷺ) contribute to the understanding of dress code in Islam?

hadith-eng: That the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Allah has cursed the woman who artificially lengthens and the woman who seeks to have her hair artificially lengthened, and the woman who tattoos and the woman who seeks tattooed." Nafi' (one of the narrators) said: "Tattooing was on the gums."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.He said: There are narrations on this topic from Ibn Mas'ud, 'Aishah, Asma' bint Abi Bakr, Ma'qil bin Yasar, Ibn 'Abbas, and Mu'awiyah.
question: How do different narrations from various companions contribute to the understanding of prohibitions in Islam?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited riding (while sitting on) Miyathir."[Abu 'Eisa said:] There are narrations on this topic from 'Ali and Mu'awiyah. The Hadith if Al-Bara' is Hasan Sahih. Shu'bah reported similarly from Ash'ath bin Abi Ash-Sha'tha' in the lengthy Hadith.
question: What is the classification of hadith and how does it affect its acceptance in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: "The only bed that the Messenger of Allah had which he slept was [made of a tanned skin] stuffed with palm-fibres."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.He Said: There are narrations on thus topic from Hafsah and Jabir.
question: How does the Prophet's example of simplicity in personal comfort influence Islamic teachings on modesty and humility?

hadith-eng: "The most loved garment to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was the Qamis (long shirt)."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Gharib. We only know of it as a narration of 'Abdul-Mu'min bin Khalid (a narrator in the chain of this Hadith) who was alone in narrating it, and he is from Al-Marwaz. Some of them report this Hadith from Abu Tumailah, from 'Abdul-Mu'min bin Khalid, from 'Abdullah bin Buraidah, from his mother, from Umm Salamah. He said: I heard Muhammad bin Ism'ail saying: "The narration of Ibn Buraidah from his mother, from Umm Salamah is more correct, Abu Tumailah mentioned 'his mother' in it."
question: How do scholars determine the authenticity of a hadith with multiple narrators?

hadith-eng: "The most loved garment to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was the Qamis (long shirt)."
question: What can be learned about the simplicity of the Prophet's (ﷺ) lifestyle from his choice of clothing?

hadith-eng: "The most loved garment to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was the Qamis (long shirt)."
question: What can be learned about the simplicity of the Prophet Muhammad's (ﷺ) lifestyle from his choice of clothing?

hadith-eng: "The sleeves of (the shirt) of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) were to the wrist."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Gharib.
question: How does the hadith contribute to the understanding of the Prophet's modesty in dress?

hadith-eng: "When the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) put on a Qamis he began with the right side.[Abu 'Eisa said:] Others have reported this Hadith from Shu'bah with this chain, but they dod narrate it in Marfu' form, only 'Abdus-Samad narrated it Marfu'.
question: How do different narrators affect the classification of a hadith?

hadith-eng: "When the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), would wear a new garment he would mention what it was, whether an 'Imamah, a Qamis, or a Rida', then he would say: Allahumma lakal-hamdu, Anta kasawtanihi, as'aluka khairuhu wa khaira ma suni'a lahu, wa a'udhu bika min sharrihi wa sharri ma suni'a lahu'" ('O Allah! For You is the praise, You have clothed me, I ask You for its good and the god for which it was made, and I seek refuge in You from its evil and the evil for which it was made.)[Abu 'Eisa said:] There are narrations on this topic from 'Umar, and Ibn 'Umar.
question: How does the Prophet (ﷺ) demonstrate mindfulness and consciousness of Allah in everyday actions like wearing clothes?

hadith-eng: From his father: "The Prophet (ﷺ) wore a Roman Jubbah with tight sleeves."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.
question: What does this narration suggest about the Prophet's (ﷺ) acceptance of clothing from different cultures?

hadith-eng: From Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah: "Dihyah Al-Kalbi gave a pair of Khuff to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), so he wore them."[Abu 'Eisa said:] Isra'il said: "From Jabir, from 'Amir: 'And a Jubbah, so he wore them until they tore. And the Prophet (ﷺ) did not know whether they were from a slaughtered animal or not.'"This Hadith is Hasan Gharib. Abu Ishaq, the one who reported from Ash-Sha'bi, is Abu Ishaq Ash-Shaibani, and his name is Sulaiman. Al-Hasan bin 'Ayyash is the brother of Abu Bakr bin 'Ayyash.
question: How are hadiths classified in terms of authenticity and what does 'Hasan Gharib' mean?

hadith-eng: "My nose was severed on the Day of Al-Kulab during Jahiliyyah. So I got a nose of silver which caused an infection for me, so the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) ordered me to get a node made of gold."
question: How does this story reflect the transition from pre-Islamic practices to Islamic guidance?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet (ﷺ) prohibited predator skins." And this chain is more correct.
question: What are the implications of using prohibited materials in Islamic practice?

hadith-eng: From Anas: "The sandals of the Prophet (ﷺ) had two straps."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.He said: There are narrations on this topic from Ibn 'Abbas, and Abu Hurairah.
question: Why is it important to preserve details about the Prophet's (ﷺ) lifestyle and possessions?

hadith-eng: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Do not walk in one sandal, either wear both sandals, or go barefoot."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.He said: There is something on this topic from Jabir.
question: What are the implications of this guidance on personal conduct and appearance in Islam?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited that a man should put on sandals while he is standing."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Gharib. 'Ubaidullah bin 'Amr Ar-Raqqi reported this Hadith from Ma'mar, from Qatadah, from Anas. Both of the Ahadith are not correct according to the people of Hadith. Al-Harith bin Nabhan is not a Hafiz according to them, and we do not know any basis for the narration of Qatadah from Anas.
question: Why might a hadith be considered incorrect by scholars of hadith?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited that a man should put on sandals while he is standing."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Gharib. Muhammad bin Isma'il said: "This Hadith is not correct, not the Hadith of Ma'mar from 'Ammar bin Abi 'Ammar, from Abu Hurairah (no.1775)."
question: Why might a hadith be considered incorrect by scholars like Muhammad bin Isma'il?

hadith-eng: "Sometimes the Prophet (ﷺ) would walk in one sandal."
question: How does the Prophet's (ﷺ) practice of walking in one sandal relate to Islamic teachings on modesty?

hadith-eng: From his father, about 'Aishah that: "She would walk in one sandal."This is more correct. [Abu 'Eisa said:] This is how it was reported by Sufyan Ath-Thawri and others, from 'Abdur-Rahman bin Al-Qasim, in Mawquf form, and this is more correct.
question: What role does 'Aishah play in the transmission of hadiths?

hadith-eng: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "When one of you dons sandals, then let him begin with the right. And when he removes them then let him begin with left, so that the right will be the first to put on and the last of them removed."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.
question: What does this practice of wearing sandals indicate about the attention to detail in daily actions in Islam?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said to me: 'If you want to stick with me, then suffice yourself in the world with the provisions of the rider. And beware of gatherings of the rich, and do not consider a garment to be worn out until it has been patched.'"[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Gharib, we do not know of it except as a narration of Salih bin Hassan. He said: I heard Muhammad bin Isma'il saying: "Salih bin Hassan is Munkar is Hadith." And Salih bin Hassan - the one who Ibn Abi Dhi'b reports from - is trustworthy.[Abu 'Eisa said:] The meaning of this saying: "And beware of gathering of the rich" is similar to what was related from Abu Hurairah from the Prophet (ﷺ), that he said: "Whoever sees one that has been more favored than him in appearance and provision, then let him look at the one who is less than him, rather than one who is favored more than him. For indeed it is more appropriate so that he not scorn Allah's favors [upon him]."And it has been related from 'Awn bin 'Abdullah who said: "I accompanied the rich, and did not see anyone with more troubles than me. I saw a beast that was better than my beast, and a garment that was better than my garment. And I accompanied the poor, and felt at ease."
question: What is the significance of patching a garment before considering it worn out in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) arrived in Makkah, and he had four braids."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Gharib. Muhammad said: "I do not know of Mujahid (a narrator) hearing from Umm Hani."
question: What is the role of individual narrators in the transmission of hadiths?

hadith-eng: "I heard Abu Kabshah Al-Anmari saying: 'The Kimam (caps) of the Companions of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) were Buthan (stretched over the head).'"[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Munkar,  'Abdullah bin Busr is from Al-Basrah, and he is weak according to the people of Hadith. Yahya bin Sa'eed and others graded him weak. Buthun means expansive.
question: Why is it important to assess the strength or weakness of a hadith narrator?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) took hold of the calf of my shin - or his shin - and he said: "This is the place of the Izar, if you must lower it, then the Izar has no right to be on the ankles."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih. Ath-Thawri and Shu'bah reported it from Abu Ishaq.
question: What are the implications of wearing the Izar incorrectly according to Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: From his father that Rukanah wrestled the Prophet (ﷺ) and the Prophet (ﷺ) won the match. Rukanah said: "I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying: 'Indeed what distinguishes between us and between the idolater is the turban over the cap.'"[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Gharib. Its chain is not established, and we do not know of Abu Al-Hasan Al-'Asqalani, nor Ibn Rukanah.
question: What role does attire play in differentiating religious identities in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: From his father who said: "A man wearing an iron ring came to the Prophet (ﷺ). So he said to him: 'What is this I see on you, jewelry of the people of the Fire ?' Then he came wearing a ring of brass. So he said: 'What is this smell of idols I sense on you ?' Then he came wearing a ring of gold. So he said to him: 'What is this jewelry of the people of Paradise I see on you ?' So he said: 'What should I use then ?' He said: 'From silver, but not its entire weight."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Gharib and there are narrations on this topic from 'Abdullah bin 'Amr, and 'Abdullah bin Muslim's Kunyah is Abu Taibah, and he is from Al-Marwaz.
question: How does the choice of jewelry reflect one's adherence to Islamic principles?

hadith-eng: "I heard 'Ali saying: 'The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited Al-Qassi, the red Mitharah, and wearing rings on this and this.' And he pointed to the index and middle fingers."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih. Ibn Abi Musa is Abu Burdah bin Abi Musa and his name is 'Amir bin 'Abdullah bin Qais.
question: What is the significance of the red Mitharah in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: "The garment the Messenger (ﷺ) like most to wear was the Hibrah."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih Gharib.
question: What can be learned about the simplicity or style of clothing from the Prophet's (ﷺ) choice of garments?

hadith-eng: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Wearing silk and gold has made unlawful for the males of my Ummah and lawful for its females.[Abu 'Eisa said:] There are narrations on this topic from 'Umar, 'Ali, 'Uqbah bin 'Amir, Anas, Umm Hani, Hudhaifah, 'Abdullah bin 'Amr, 'Imran bin Husain, 'Abdullah bin Az-Zubair, Jabir, Abu Raihanah, Ibn 'Umar, Al-Bara', and Wathilah bin Al-Asqa', and this Hadith is Hasan Sahih.
question: What are the implications of wearing prohibited items for males in the context of Islamic law?

hadith-eng: That 'Abdur Rahman bin 'Awf and Az-Zubair bin Al-'Awwam complained of lice to the Prophet (ﷺ) during a battle that they participated in. So he permitted them to wear silk shirts. He  (Anas) said: "I saw them wearing them."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih
question: What are the conditions under which wearing silk is permissible for men in Islam?

hadith-eng: "Anas bin Malik arrived. So I went to him and he said: 'Who are you ?' I said: 'I am Waqid bin 'Amr [bin Sa'd bin Ma'adh].'" He said: "So he began to cry and he said: 'You resemble Sa'd. Sa'd was one of the greatest people, and of the tallest. The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was sent a cloak of Dibaj with gold woven into it. The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) wore it and ascended the Minbar. Then he stood, or sat, and the people began touching it, and they said: 'We never saw a garment like this before today.' So he said: 'Are you amazed at this ? The handkerchiefs of Sa'd in Paradise are better than what you see.'"He said: There is something on this topic from Asma' bint Abu Bakr. This Hadith is Sahih.
question: How does the hadith illustrate the emotional connection between the companions and their memories of each other?

hadith-eng: "I have not seen anyone with hair past his shoulders in a red Hullah more handsome than the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ). He had hair that would flow on his shoulders, (and he had) broad shoulders (and he was) not too short and not too long."[Abu 'Eisa said:] There are narrations on this topic from Jabir bin Samurah, Abu Rimthah, and Abu Juhaifah. This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.
question: What is the importance of describing the Prophet's physical attributes in hadith literature?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited wearing Al-Qassi and what was dyed with 'Usfur."[Abu 'Eisa said:] There are narrations on this topic from Anas and 'Abdullah bin 'Amr.
question: How do different narrations contribute to understanding the Islamic dress code?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was asked about fat, cheese, and furs, so he said: 'The lawful is what Allah made lawful in His Book, the unlawful is what Allah made unlawful in his Book, and what He was silent about; then it is among that for which He has pardoned.'"[Abu 'Eisa said:] There is something on this topic from Al-Mughirah, and this Hadith is Gharib, we do not know of it being Marfu' except from this route. Sufyan and others reported it from Sulaiman At-Taimi, from Abu 'Uthman, from Salman as his own saying. It is as if the Mawquf narration is more correct. I asked Al-Bukhari about this Hadith and he said: 'I do not think it is preserved. Sufyan reported it from Sulaiman At-Taimi from Abu 'Uthman, from Salman in Mawquf form.' Al-Bukhari said: "Saif bin Harun is Muqarib (Average) in Hadith, and as for Saif bin Muhammad from 'Asim, his narrations are left."
question: What is the role of personal judgment in interpreting Islamic law when explicit guidance is not available?

hadith-eng: "A sheep died so the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said to its owners: 'Why dont you remove its skin, then tan it so you can have something useful from it."[Abu 'Eisa said:] There are narrations on this topic from Salamah bin Al-Muhabbaq, Maimunah, and 'Aishah. The Hadith of Ibn 'Abbas is Hasan Sahih. Similar to this has been reported through other routes from Ibn 'Abbas from the Prophet (ﷺ). And it has been related from Ibn 'Abbas from Maimunah, from the Prophet (ﷺ), and, it has been related from him from Sawdah. I heard Muhammad saying the Hadith of Ibn 'Abbas from Maimunah from the Prophet (ﷺ) were correct. And he said: "It implies that it was reported from Ibn 'Abbas from Maimunah from the Prophet (ﷺ), and that Ibn 'Abbas reported it from the Prophet (ﷺ), and he did not mention Maimunah in it."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This is acted upon according to most of the people of knowledge, and it is the view of Sufyan At-Thawri, Ibn Al-Mubarak, Ash-Shafi'i, Ahmad, and Ishaq.
question: What are the implications of this hadith on the understanding of halal and haram in Islamic law?

hadith-eng: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Any skin tanned, then it has been made pure."This Hadith is Hasan Sahih. This is acted upon according to most of the people of knowledge, they say that when the skin of a dead animal has been tanned then it has been made pure.[Abu 'Eisa said:] Ash-Shafi'i said: "Any dead animals skin that is tanned, then it has been made pure, except for the dog and the pig." Some of the people of knowledge among the Companions of the Prophet (ﷺ) disliked skins of predators even when tanned, and this is the view of 'Abdullah bin Al-Mubarak, Ahmad and Ishaq, and they were firm about not wearing them and performing Salat in them. Ishaq bin Ibrahim said: "The saying of the Prophet (ﷺ):'Any skin that is tanned, then it has been made pure' only refers to the skins of animals whose meat is eaten." This is how it was explained by An-Nasr bin Shumail.
question: How does Ishaq bin Ibrahim interpret the hadith about tanning and purity?

hadith-eng: "A letter came from the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying: 'Do not use the skins of dead animals, nor tendons.'"[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan. This Hadith has been related to 'Abdullah bin 'Ukaim from some Shuyukh of his, and this is not acted upon according to most of the people of knowledge. And this Hadith has been related from 'Abdullah bin 'Ukaim, that he said: "A letter came to us from the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) two months before he died."He said: I heart Ahmad bin Al-Hasan saying: "Ahmad bin Hanbal followed this Hadith due to it mentioning that it was two months before he (ﷺ) died. Then Ahmad left this Hadith because of their Idtirab in its chain, since some of them reported it, saying: 'From 'Abdullah bin 'Ukaim from some Shuyukh of his from Juhainah.'"
question: What role does the chain of narration play in determining the reliability of a hadith?

hadith-eng: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "On the day of judgement, Allah will not look at one who arrogantly drags his garment.[Abu 'Eisa said:] There are narrations on this topic from Hudhaifah, Abu Sa'eed, Abu Hurairah, Samurah, Abu Dharr, 'Aishah and Hubaib bin Mughfil. The Hadith of Ibn 'Umar is Hasan Sahih.
question: How do different companions of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) contribute to the understanding of this teaching?

hadith-eng: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Whoever arrogantly drags his garment, Allah will not look at him on the Day of Judgement." So Umm Salamah said: "What should the women do with their hems?" He said: "Slacken them a handspan." So she said: "Then their feet will be uncovered." He said: "Then slacken them a forearm's length and do not add to that."He said: This Hadith is Hasan Sahih. In the Hadith there is a concession for women to drag their Izar because it covers them better.
question: What guidance did the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) provide to women concerning the length of their garments?

hadith-eng: "'Aishah brought a patched woolen Kisa' (cloak), and a thick Izar, She said: 'The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) died in these.'"[Abu 'Eisa said:] There are narrations on this topic from 'Ali and Ibn Mas'ud. The Hadith if 'Aishah is Hasan Sahih Hadith.
question: What is the significance of 'Aishah's testimony about the Prophet's clothing in Islamic tradition?

hadith-eng: That the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "On the day of His Lord spoke to him, Musa was wearing a wool Kisa', a wool Jubbah, a wool Kummah, wool pants, and his sandals were made of the skin of a dead donkey."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Gharib, we do not know of it except from the the narration of Humaid Al-A'raj. And Humaid - Ibn 'Ali Al-A'raj - I Heard Muhammad saying: "Humaid bin 'Ali Al-A'raj is Munkar in Hadith." While Humaid ibn Qais Al-A'raj Al-Makki, the companion of Mujahid is trustworthy. The Kummah is a small cap.
question: What is the role of a Kummah in traditional Islamic attire?

hadith-eng: "On the day of the Conquest, the Prophet (ﷺ) entered Makkah, and he was wearing a black 'Imamah."[He said:] THere are narrations on this topic from 'Ali, 'Amr bin Huraith, Ibn 'Abbas, Rukanah.[Abu 'Eisa said:] The Hadith is Jabir is Hasan Sahih Hadith.
question: Who are some of the notable companions who narrated hadiths about the Prophet's actions during the Conquest of Makkah?

hadith-eng: That Ibn 'Umar said: "When the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) would wear an 'Imamah would hang between his shoulders."Nafi' said: "Ibn 'Umar would hang his 'Imamah between his shoulders." 'Ubaidullah said: "And I saw Al-Qasim and Salim doing that."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Gharib. And there is something on this topic from 'Ali. And this Hadith of 'Ali about this is not correct due to its chain.
question: What are the implications of a hadith being considered not correct due to its chain?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited me from rings of gold, and from wearing Al-Qassi, and from reciting in the bowing and prostration positions, and from wearing what was dyed with 'Usfur."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.
question: How does Islamic guidance address the use of specific materials in personal adornment?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited us from (wearing) rings of gold."[He said:] THere are narrations on this topic from 'Ali, Ibn 'Umar, Abu Hurairah, and Mu'awiyah.[Abu 'Eisa said:] The Hadith of 'Imran is a Hasan Hadith. Abu At-Tayyah's (a narrator) name is Yazid bin Humaid.
question: Who was Abu At-Tayyah and what role did he play in the narration of hadith?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet (ﷺ) had a ring of gold made for him which he wore on his right (hand). Then he sat on the Minbar and said: 'I did indeed have this ring on my right hand' then he discarded it and the people discarded their rings."He said: There are narrations on this topic from 'Ali, Jabir, 'Abdullah bin Ja'far, Ibn 'Abbas, 'Aishah, and Anas.[Abu 'Eisa said:] The Hadith of Ibn 'Umar is Hasan Sahih Hadith. This Hadith has been reported similarly from 'Nafi, from Ibn 'Umar, through routes other than this, and it was not mentioned in it that the ring was on his right hand.
question: What are the implications of wearing jewelry for men in Islamic teachings based on this narration?

hadith-eng: "Ibn Abbas wore a ring on his right hand. And I do not doubt he said: 'I saw the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) wearing a ring on his right hand.'"[Abu 'Eisa said:] Muhammad bin Isma'il said: "The Hadith is Muhammad bin Ishaq from As-Salt bin 'Abdullah bin Nawfal is a Hasan Sahih Hadith."
question: What role does personal observation play in the authentication of hadiths?

hadith-eng: "I saw Ibn Rafi' [and he is 'Ubaidullah bin Abi Rafi', the freed slave of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) - and Aslam was the name of Ibn Abi Rafi] wearing a ring on his right, so I asked him about that. He said, 'I saw 'Abdullah bin Ja'far wearing a ring on his right hand, and he ['Abdullah bin Ja'far] said: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) wore a ring on his right hand."He said: Muhammad [bin Isma'il] said: "This is the most correct thing related from the Prophet (ﷺ) on this topic."
question: How does the authenticity of a hadith impact Islamic practices?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) had a ring made from silver, so he had 'Muhammad, the Messenger of Allah' engraved on it. Then he said: 'Do not engrave with it.'[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Sahih Hasan. As for the meaning of his saying: "Do not engrave with it" - he was prohibiting that anyone have "Muhammad, Messenger of Allah" engraved on his ring.
question: What can be inferred about the use of personal inscriptions on jewelry in Islam from this narration?

hadith-eng: "The inscription on the ring of the Prophet (ﷺ) was in three line: 'Muhammad' on a line, 'Messenger' on a line, 'Allah' on a line." And Muhammad bin Yahya (one of the two who narrated to him) did not say: "Three lines" in his narration.There are narrations on this topic from Ibn 'Umar.[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith of Anas is a Hasan  Sahih Gharib.
question: What is the significance of the inscription on the Prophet's ring?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited having images in the house, and he prohibited making them."He said: There are narrations on this topic from 'Ali, Abu Talhah, 'Aishah, Abu Hurairah, and Abu Ayyub.[Abu 'Eisa said:] The Hadith of Jabir is a Hasan Sahih Hadith.
question: How does the prohibition of images relate to the teachings of the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng: From 'Ubaidullah bin 'Abdullah bin 'Utbah, that he entered upon Abu Talhah Al-Ansari to pay him a visit (while he was ill), and he found Sahl bin Hunaif with him. He said: "Abu Talhah called for someone to remove a sheet that was under him. Sahl said to him: 'Why did you remove it?' He replied: 'Because it contains images on it, and the Prophet (ﷺ) said about them what you know.' Sahl said: 'Do he not say: Except for markings on a garment?' He said: 'Yes, but this is better to me.'"[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.
question: How do different companions recall and apply the teachings of the Prophet (ﷺ) in their daily lives?

hadith-eng: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Whoever fashions an image, he will be punished by Allah until he breathes into it - meaning the soul - and he cannot breath (a soul) into it. And whoever listens to a people's conversation, while they have gone away from him for it, then He will have lead poured into his ears on the Day of Judgement."He said: There are narrations on this topic from 'Abdullah bin Mas'ud, Abu Hurairah, Abu Juhaifah, 'Aishah, and Ibn 'Umar.[Abu 'Eisa said:] The Hadith of Ibn 'Abbas is a Hasan Sahih Hadith.
question: What punishments are mentioned for those who engage in creating images or eavesdropping?

hadith-eng: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Change the gray, and do not resemble the Jews."He said: There are narration on this topic from Az-Zubair, Ibn 'Abbas, Jabir, Abu Dharr, Anas, Abu Rimthah, Al-Jahdamah, Abu At-Tufail, Jabir bin Samurah, Abu Juhaifah, and Ibn 'Umar.[Abu 'Eisa said:] The Hadith of Abu Hurairah is a Hasan Sahih Hadith, and it has been reported through other routes from Abu Hurairah from the Prophet (ﷺ).
question: How does the practice of changing gray hair relate to cultural or religious identity in Islam?

hadith-eng: That the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Indeed the best of what the gray may be changed with is Henna' and Katam."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih. Abu Al-Aswad Ad-Dili's (a narrator in this chain) name is Zalim bin 'Amr bin Sufyan.
question: What does the term 'Hasan Sahih' indicate about a hadith's classification?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was of average height, neither tall nor very short, he had a good build, brown in complexion, his hair was neither curly nor straight, and when he walked he swayed slightly."He said: There are narration on this topic from 'Aishah, Al-Bara', Abu Hurairah, Ibn 'Abbas, Abu Sa'eed, Jabir, Wa'il bin Hujr, and Umm Hani'.[Abu 'Eisa said:] The Hadith of Anas is a Hasan Sahih Gharib Hadith from this route, as a narration of Humaid.
question: How does the hadith describe the Prophet Muhammad's (ﷺ) hair?

hadith-eng:
"I and the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) would perform Ghusl using (water from) the same vessel. He had hair reaching above his shoulders and below his earlobes."This Hadith is Hasan Sahih Gharib.
[Abu 'Eisa said:] It has been reported from other routes that 'Aishah said: "I and the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) would perform Ghusl using (water from) the same vessel." And the following statement is not mentioned in it: "He had hair reaching above his shoulders [and below his earlobes'."It was only mentioned by 'Abdur-Rahman bin Abi Az-Zinad, and he is trustworthy, a Hafiz, and Malik bin Anas stated that he was trustworthy and ordered recording (Ahadith) from him.
question: How does this narration contribute to our understanding of the Prophet Muhammad's (ﷺ) daily life and practices?

hadith-eng: That the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Use Ithmid for Kohl, for it clears the vision and grows the hair (eye-lashes)." And he claimed that the Prophet (ﷺ) had a Kohl holder with which he would apply Kohl every night, three in this (eye) and three in this.Another chain with similar meaning.He said: There are narrations on this topic from Jabir and Ibn 'Umar[Abu 'Eisa said:] The Hadith of Ibn 'Abbas is a Hasan Gharib Hadith, we do not know of it with this wording except from the narration of 'Abbas bin Mansur.
question: How is the hadith about using Ithmid for kohl classified in terms of authenticity?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited two types of dress: As-Sama', and that a man sits with his legs drawn up in a garment, while there is nothing covering his private area.[Abu 'Eisa said:] There are narrations on this topic from 'Ali, Ibn 'Umar, 'Aishah, Abu Sa'eed, Jabir, and Abu Umamah. The Hadith if Abu Hurairah is a Hasan Sahih Gharib Hadith from this route.This has been reported through other routes from Abu Hurairah from the Prophet (ﷺ).
question: What is the significance of the classification 'Hasan Sahih Gharib' in the context of hadith literature?

hadith-eng: That the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Allah has cursed the woman who artificially lengthens and the woman who seeks to have her hair artificially lengthened, and the woman who tattoos and the woman who seeks tattooed." Nafi' (one of the narrators) said: "Tattooing was on the gums."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.He said: There are narrations on this topic from Ibn Mas'ud, 'Aishah, Asma' bint Abi Bakr, Ma'qil bin Yasar, Ibn 'Abbas, and Mu'awiyah.
question: What is the significance of authenticity and classification of hadiths in Islamic jurisprudence?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited riding (while sitting on) Miyathir."[Abu 'Eisa said:] There are narrations on this topic from 'Ali and Mu'awiyah. The Hadith if Al-Bara' is Hasan Sahih. Shu'bah reported similarly from Ash'ath bin Abi Ash-Sha'tha' in the lengthy Hadith.
question: Who were some of the companions that narrated similar teachings regarding prohibitions in Islam?

hadith-eng: "The only bed that the Messenger of Allah had which he slept was [made of a tanned skin] stuffed with palm-fibres."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.He Said: There are narrations on thus topic from Hafsah and Jabir.
question: What are the implications of the Prophet's simple lifestyle for contemporary Muslims seeking to emulate his example?

hadith-eng: "The most loved garment to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) was the Qamis (long shirt)."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Gharib. We only know of it as a narration of 'Abdul-Mu'min bin Khalid (a narrator in the chain of this Hadith) who was alone in narrating it, and he is from Al-Marwaz. Some of them report this Hadith from Abu Tumailah, from 'Abdul-Mu'min bin Khalid, from 'Abdullah bin Buraidah, from his mother, from Umm Salamah. He said: I heard Muhammad bin Ism'ail saying: "The narration of Ibn Buraidah from his mother, from Umm Salamah is more correct, Abu Tumailah mentioned 'his mother' in it."
question: What challenges arise in the transmission of hadiths with varying chains of narrators?

hadith-eng: "When the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) put on a Qamis he began with the right side.[Abu 'Eisa said:] Others have reported this Hadith from Shu'bah with this chain, but they dod narrate it in Marfu' form, only 'Abdus-Samad narrated it Marfu'.
question: What is the role of Abu Hurairah in the transmission of hadiths?

hadith-eng: "When the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), would wear a new garment he would mention what it was, whether an 'Imamah, a Qamis, or a Rida', then he would say: Allahumma lakal-hamdu, Anta kasawtanihi, as'aluka khairuhu wa khaira ma suni'a lahu, wa a'udhu bika min sharrihi wa sharri ma suni'a lahu'" ('O Allah! For You is the praise, You have clothed me, I ask You for its good and the god for which it was made, and I seek refuge in You from its evil and the evil for which it was made.)[Abu 'Eisa said:] There are narrations on this topic from 'Umar, and Ibn 'Umar.
question: What can be learned about the dual nature of worldly possessions from the supplication made by the Prophet (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng: From his father: "The Prophet (ﷺ) wore a Roman Jubbah with tight sleeves."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.
question: How does the description of the sleeves provide insight into the style of clothing worn by the Prophet (ﷺ)?

hadith-eng: From Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah: "Dihyah Al-Kalbi gave a pair of Khuff to the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ), so he wore them."[Abu 'Eisa said:] Isra'il said: "From Jabir, from 'Amir: 'And a Jubbah, so he wore them until they tore. And the Prophet (ﷺ) did not know whether they were from a slaughtered animal or not.'"This Hadith is Hasan Gharib. Abu Ishaq, the one who reported from Ash-Sha'bi, is Abu Ishaq Ash-Shaibani, and his name is Sulaiman. Al-Hasan bin 'Ayyash is the brother of Abu Bakr bin 'Ayyash.
question: Who are the key narrators mentioned in this hadith and what is their significance in Islamic scholarship?

hadith-eng: "My nose was severed on the Day of Al-Kulab during Jahiliyyah. So I got a nose of silver which caused an infection for me, so the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) ordered me to get a node made of gold."
question: What can be learned about the permissibility of using precious metals for medical reasons from this narration?

hadith-eng: "The Prophet (ﷺ) prohibited predator skins." And this chain is more correct.
question: How does the authenticity of a hadith chain affect its acceptance in Islamic jurisprudence?

hadith-eng: From Anas: "The sandals of the Prophet (ﷺ) had two straps."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.He said: There are narrations on this topic from Ibn 'Abbas, and Abu Hurairah.
question: How do scholars classify the authenticity of hadiths related to the Prophet's (ﷺ) personal items?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited that a man should put on sandals while he is standing."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Gharib. 'Ubaidullah bin 'Amr Ar-Raqqi reported this Hadith from Ma'mar, from Qatadah, from Anas. Both of the Ahadith are not correct according to the people of Hadith. Al-Harith bin Nabhan is not a Hafiz according to them, and we do not know any basis for the narration of Qatadah from Anas.
question: What role does the reliability of narrators play in the classification of hadith?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited that a man should put on sandals while he is standing."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Gharib. Muhammad bin Isma'il said: "This Hadith is not correct, not the Hadith of Ma'mar from 'Ammar bin Abi 'Ammar, from Abu Hurairah (no.1775)."
question: What are the potential reasons for discrepancies in hadith narrations?

hadith-eng: "Sometimes the Prophet (ﷺ) would walk in one sandal."
question: What significance does the Prophet's (ﷺ) choice of footwear have in understanding his daily practices?

hadith-eng: From his father, about 'Aishah that: "She would walk in one sandal."This is more correct. [Abu 'Eisa said:] This is how it was reported by Sufyan Ath-Thawri and others, from 'Abdur-Rahman bin Al-Qasim, in Mawquf form, and this is more correct.
question: How do different narrators influence the understanding of a hadith?

hadith-eng: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "When one of you dons sandals, then let him begin with the right. And when he removes them then let him begin with left, so that the right will be the first to put on and the last of them removed."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih.
question: How does this guidance on wearing sandals relate to the concept of cleanliness and order in Islam?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said to me: 'If you want to stick with me, then suffice yourself in the world with the provisions of the rider. And beware of gatherings of the rich, and do not consider a garment to be worn out until it has been patched.'"[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Gharib, we do not know of it except as a narration of Salih bin Hassan. He said: I heard Muhammad bin Isma'il saying: "Salih bin Hassan is Munkar is Hadith." And Salih bin Hassan - the one who Ibn Abi Dhi'b reports from - is trustworthy.[Abu 'Eisa said:] The meaning of this saying: "And beware of gathering of the rich" is similar to what was related from Abu Hurairah from the Prophet (ﷺ), that he said: "Whoever sees one that has been more favored than him in appearance and provision, then let him look at the one who is less than him, rather than one who is favored more than him. For indeed it is more appropriate so that he not scorn Allah's favors [upon him]."And it has been related from 'Awn bin 'Abdullah who said: "I accompanied the rich, and did not see anyone with more troubles than me. I saw a beast that was better than my beast, and a garment that was better than my garment. And I accompanied the poor, and felt at ease."
question: How does associating with the poor affect one's sense of contentment and ease?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) arrived in Makkah, and he had four braids."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Gharib. Muhammad said: "I do not know of Mujahid (a narrator) hearing from Umm Hani."
question: How does the concept of 'Gharib' hadith affect its acceptance and understanding?

hadith-eng: "I heard Abu Kabshah Al-Anmari saying: 'The Kimam (caps) of the Companions of the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) were Buthan (stretched over the head).'"[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Munkar,  'Abdullah bin Busr is from Al-Basrah, and he is weak according to the people of Hadith. Yahya bin Sa'eed and others graded him weak. Buthun means expansive.
question: What are the implications of a hadith being classified as 'Munkar'?

hadith-eng: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) took hold of the calf of my shin - or his shin - and he said: "This is the place of the Izar, if you must lower it, then the Izar has no right to be on the ankles."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih. Ath-Thawri and Shu'bah reported it from Abu Ishaq.
question: What does the hadith suggest about modesty in clothing?

hadith-eng: From his father that Rukanah wrestled the Prophet (ﷺ) and the Prophet (ﷺ) won the match. Rukanah said: "I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying: 'Indeed what distinguishes between us and between the idolater is the turban over the cap.'"[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Gharib. Its chain is not established, and we do not know of Abu Al-Hasan Al-'Asqalani, nor Ibn Rukanah.
question: How does the concept of competition or sportsmanship appear in Islamic teachings?

hadith-eng: From his father who said: "A man wearing an iron ring came to the Prophet (ﷺ). So he said to him: 'What is this I see on you, jewelry of the people of the Fire ?' Then he came wearing a ring of brass. So he said: 'What is this smell of idols I sense on you ?' Then he came wearing a ring of gold. So he said to him: 'What is this jewelry of the people of Paradise I see on you ?' So he said: 'What should I use then ?' He said: 'From silver, but not its entire weight."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Gharib and there are narrations on this topic from 'Abdullah bin 'Amr, and 'Abdullah bin Muslim's Kunyah is Abu Taibah, and he is from Al-Marwaz.
question: What alternatives are suggested for men regarding the type of rings they should wear?

hadith-eng: "I heard 'Ali saying: 'The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) prohibited Al-Qassi, the red Mitharah, and wearing rings on this and this.' And he pointed to the index and middle fingers."[Abu 'Eisa said:] This Hadith is Hasan Sahih. Ibn Abi Musa is Abu Burdah bin Abi Musa and his name is 'Amir bin 'Abdullah bin Qais.
question: How is the authenticity of this hadith classified in Islamic scholarship?

hadith-eng: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Any skin tanned, then it has been made pure."This Hadith is Hasan Sahih. This is acted upon according to most of the people of knowledge, they say that when the skin of a dead animal has been tanned then it has been made pure.[Abu 'Eisa said:] Ash-Shafi'i said: "Any dead animals skin that is tanned, then it has been made pure, except for the dog and the pig." Some of the people of knowledge among the Companions of the Prophet (ﷺ) disliked skins of predators even when tanned, and this is the view of 'Abdullah bin Al-Mubarak, Ahmad and Ishaq, and they were firm about not wearing them and performing Salat in them. Ishaq bin Ibrahim said: "The saying of the Prophet (ﷺ):'Any skin that is tanned, then it has been made pure' only refers to the skins of animals whose meat is eaten." This is how it was explained by An-Nasr bin Shumail.
question: What are the views of 'Abdullah bin Al-Mubarak, Ahmad, and Ishaq on wearing and praying in tanned skins?
